website_summaries.verdict: A solid little grill that cooks fast, but some users may be put off by how hot it gets. This could be especially frustrating for those who don't like foods well-done or don't want to watch food the entire time it's cooking.
pros: A rugged portable gas grill that exceeds expectations for its travel-friendly features and impressive cooking abilities
Aluminum construction protects the heating and cooking components
Sturdy latches keep it secure while on the go
cons: It doesn't have heat control, so the extremely hot cooking temperatures take some getting used to
It has the tendency to overcook
Grill grate crevices are difficult to clean

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Bayou Classic control valve and you’ll have a great grill!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice grill but if you have read the reviews a repetitive compliant is that it is too hot. Absolutely agree but if you read the Sept. 8th 2015 review that recommends the Bayou classic control, take the advice. With this valve you can reduce the temp to whatever you want and can cook moist chicken breasts and perfect slow cooked ribs (350 deg on the temp gauge). Spend $20 extra bucks on this valve with adaptors and you will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Ritchie K Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Problem with the grid
customer_reviews.text: The grill works well. I've had it for some weeks now and used it to cook some steaks and they were delicious. However, after the first use I notice the grid is starting to rot away as seen in the attached pics. It's very difficult to believe this is stainless steel and deteriorating so rapidly. So far, nothing else is wrong with the grill but need the replacement grid at the very least.
customer_reviews.author: G. Gill

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this grill.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy!!!!! I'm on my second regulator for this grill. Be very careful if you already have one. Sometimes the valve does not close correctly and you have gas leaking out and you won't know about it and when you go to lite it will catch the whole grill on fire.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Ward

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy Without Ordering A Box Of Replacement Regulators
customer_reviews.text: This could be a wonderful product but it fails because of one component, the cheap crap regulator. I've had mine for less than a year and right now it is a boat anchor because the regulator failed and Char Broil is not currently listing a replacement. Before it failed it didn't really regulate the gas well enough to control the temperature. The only real control was to open or close the lid.
customer_reviews.author: David L. KochTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: With a straightforward fix, it's a great little grill.
customer_reviews.text: First -- season the dang grill!!! It's really required for the easy clean up method you can read about in other posts. Second -- you need a needle a 1/8" Needle valve to add inline, fo you can fine tune the flame to lower settings. YOU DON"T NEED TO GET A 1/4" VALVE, AND 2 ADAPTERS, TO PROVE YOUR A RUBE GOLDBERG FAN -- OMG!!! Just search for 1/8" Needle valve, pay $12 for a circular handled model, and find your teflon tape. Shoe me some love of this review. :-) KISS baby!!!
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE L WILLIS

customer_reviews.title: low setting on regulator still heats over 450
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyed the first few times using as quick heat and searing was great; I have owned this for about a half a year and used it less than 24 times; the regulator has failed and will no longer turn the heat down. The grill is showing extensive wear as it always runs at 450 unless i shut it off. (which I do) I now get the wonderful experience of finding out what customer service is like and whether the manufacturer will stand by their warrantee.
customer_reviews.author: kitkatt

customer_reviews.title: The grill worked fine until the regulator quit working
customer_reviews.text: The grill worked fine until the regulator quit working. I could no longer control the temp., it was always high and I could no longer shut it off enough so that the bottle of propane ran dry. I have been trying to get a new regulator, but they are back ordered. It seems a lot of people have been having this problem.
customer_reviews.author: j.f.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Update: after only one use an a thorough cleaning and storing inside house... the internals of the grill have already begun rusting. Cannot recommend this product. The grill performance decently. Seems to have even heat and easy enough to clean with some steel wool. However for a grill being advertised as a "grill to go" it is very cumbersome and awkwardly shaped. Difficult to store, or carry. If your looking for a grill to take to the beach or something look elsewhere. If you want a grill to just sit on your patio this should be good .
customer_reviews.author: Triston Murray

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: burns to hot burns food. update used this unit for the second with another regulator still burnt food i got rid of it don't buy over priced junk i tried a grill mat on it and it still burnt the food i have old Weber BBQ I"m going to restore and it will work fine once i replace some parts' this BBQ was nice looking but that's all
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: I hate this grill
customer_reviews.text: The headline pretty much sums it up. I got this last summer, and no matter what I do, it chars every single thing I try to cook on it. I even jimmy-rigged a way to prop the lid open while it's heating up/cooking, and it still maxes out over the 650 degree temperature gauge. It could be heating up to 1,000 degrees for all I know. I'm going to give it away and buy something else. I wish I would have returned it after I got it, but was being stubborn and trying to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Antebean

customer_reviews.title: Hot grill/ Then not so hot grill.
customer_reviews.text: Updated review. It's been about 3 months since I received the grill. It was great for searing at first. Couldn't keep it under 600 degrees. Then it wouldn't heat past 350. Then it wouldn't stay lit. I got a second regulator and that solved the problem... for a couple of weeks. 😕 Now the same thing is happening. Won't heat past 350. Not sure if I can recommend this item anymore. Initial review: This grill is great for searing. I knew infrared were for fast grilling but the temperature control is basically 600f or off with the regulator provided. I'm on my second regulator after about a dozen uses. Amazon customer service credited me to offset the cost.
customer_reviews.author: J. Strobel

customer_reviews.title: Great grill for my motorhome.
customer_reviews.text: After using this grill for several months I still like it a lot. It cooks very hot so you do have to be careful. The grate does protect from flare ups and sears well. It does have to be cleaned well after each use because the slots in the grate get clogged. Overall it does a great job for what I bought it for, carrying in my motorhome. The case that's made for it is also well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Very dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: Way to intense with the heat with no proper adjustment. I wanted something hotter than my Q grill to get a char on my steaks but the small thin surface contact on this grill along with not being able to adjust the heat makes for over charged marks so you taste burnt meant not a char. Verrrrry disappointing. And whoever says you can adapt a bayou valve on it must know something I don't because you cannot separate the existing tube from the control to do so. Very difficult to find a decent portable grill that will char steaks without over cooking or over burning. If someone has one please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Pilgrim

customer_reviews.title: I should have read the reviews better the one-star rating should be 0 Regulators not working ...
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the reviews better the one-star rating should be 0 Regulators not working right out of the box temperature does not go under 700 degrees even on low setting please read all of the reviews and do not buy this product have to return to Amazon hopefully I don't have to pay shipping thought this would be a great product I was wrong
customer_reviews.author: Charles Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Good Portable Grill-Needs Customizing
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality grill overall. The bottom is a thick metal. The lid hinge is durable and closes well. Once latched, this is easy to carry with or without a carry case. The main flaw is the temperature control. As has already been stated by other owners, the default is wide open. My first hotdogs and sausages were charbroiled at 600 degrees F. I had to cut into the regulator pipe and attach a brass valve. After installing the valve, I am able to keep the temp at 200-300 degrees easily for pork and chicken. Expect 3-4 hours cooking from a 1lb. bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Ashworth

customer_reviews.title: Great When It Stays Lit !!
customer_reviews.text: Great grill when it stays lit. If there is even a slight breeze it blows the flame out. This makes it very problematic. I've had to give up on it several times and use the stove. I've never had this problem with other gas grills. If the engineers can figure out a solution this would definitely get 5 stars. It has lots of cooking surface, gets very hot (when it stays lit), and is very portable. I hope Char-Broil will take this challenge to fix the problem seriously and they'll have a real winner.
customer_reviews.author: RonPaulAholic

customer_reviews.title: Cooks better than grills much larger.
customer_reviews.text: Rugged, sturdy grill. Love the lid locks and the protected ignition switch. Easy and convenient to transport with multiple handles and carrying options. Infrared grill, cooks quickly and gets very hot. The temperature regulator is a little limited in its control of the flame and heat. Cooking takes a small adjustment to ensure that you are cooking thoroughly at such high temperatures. Grill mats give a little more traditional cooking control and prevent burning, though not necessary. Grill can cook Anything, and is capable of connecting to propane tanks large and small.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill
customer_reviews.text: This grill gets HOT!! Not a bad thing however even on the lowest temperature it’s still very hot. The knob to control temperature isn’t very well marked or made, it’s sometimes difficult to turn the heat off and to know which way is the hottest setting. A better designed on/off/ heat switch would be so much better. A great little grill besides that.
customer_reviews.author: Susan L. Clavin

customer_reviews.title: Not a happy Camper
customer_reviews.text: This is in no way an tru infrared grill. It is good size for camping but if you don't stand right there and watch it or close the lid, it's burned. Flare ups are horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: I cant control the heat No matter where I turn the dial. On the lowest setting it heats up to around 400 to 450. And alot of smoke
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Contreras

customer_reviews.title: Loks nice but BURNS everything.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to love it but can't. The grill house and design is excellent. the issue is the cooking grate. I have made 1 meal of burgers and 1 meal of chicken. Both CHARED before they completely cooked. even with the fuel turned down to low and the lid up. No matter what I do the grill is a nightmare to work with. I used the nylon brush. spray to season and before cooking. Nothing keep food from really sticking. Also after those 2 meals the cookingngrate is rusting completley across the surface. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: yinyogini

customer_reviews.title: Off or On. No control over temperature
customer_reviews.text: Can not regulate temperature. Within 2 minutes of turning on the temperature reached 650 F. Regulator does not regulate temperature. Only control of temperature is opening the Lid. Useless, unless you buy a separate regulator. I bought another valve and a couple of adaptors. But can't make it fit because i ordered the wrong size. It would be helpful to know which size of adaptor and valve you need to buy. Either way, the unit is NOT COMPLETE, and it should be advertised as such.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for steaks but Charbroil left me hanging on the warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. It came with a broken regulator though. Charbroil charges to reace this. Paid for the new one, all is well. This thing is durable and built like a brick shithouse. You can keep it locked closed with a tank and regulator inside. If Charbroil would square up with the broken regulator I had to pay to reace out of the box id give it 5 stars and continue to buy their products. As it stands. This is my last charbroil product.
customer_reviews.author: Mando Commando

customer_reviews.title: Great, but not as great as their home version.
customer_reviews.text: CharBroil’s Tru Infrared for our home has been one of my most satisfying purchases. For some reason they strayed from the mark on the portable unit. It uses a different grate that needs much more frequent cleaning. It provides great grill marks just like home, but it has more hot spots. Those knocking the temperature control don’t get the purpose for this unit - It’s designed to make grill marks and cook through the contact area. I knock it one star because of it’s portability. It rattles a lot and does not have any clever spots to store the cleaning tool, regulator, or gas bottles.
customer_reviews.author: dksirstone

customer_reviews.title: My first infrared
customer_reviews.text: I needed something for my RV. Fits very well in storage. Using a hose (not included), it makes a nice connection to a 20# cyl. The only thing I dont love is the way that the regulator attaches. It simply stabs into the inlet tube, then a 1/4 turn, and you are ready to light it. It feels loose even when properly installed. Then again I like things to have a more solid feel in general. Ignoring this, its a well made device. Lid has nice latches that keep everything in place even while the vehicle is in motion, and the grill rolls over. The best part of it, is that it came ready to go out of the box!
customer_reviews.author: Shrapnel45

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a large summer BBQ but I needed a smaller winter BBQ for the occasional burger or dog. This is perfect! It heats up fast, doesn't use much propane and sits on a counter outside and looks nice. I could not ask for a better BBQ. I hope it holds up as I have only had it for less than two months now. I'll update if it has problems, so if you see no update and you are reading this in 2021 or so you can assume its good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D

customer_reviews.title: Needs better ventilation
customer_reviews.text: Ok I do love this grill. I was having a hard time getting the heat up to 650 in the beginning after I seasoned the grill. What I found is that the grill doesn't have proper ventilation and the flame gets choked out. The only fix I found that works is to keep the lid cracked to allow proper ventilation and keep the flame on.
customer_reviews.author: Damion

customer_reviews.title: Different
customer_reviews.text: Wow i wanted a small grill for two to four POEPLE as most buy grills far bigger then needed. This grill is a high heat grill good for burgers steaks etc this grill is for grilling not low and slow as brisket etc. it appears a lot think the regulator is not working I don't believe that is true this grill is designed for higher temp so put a frozen burger on at 600 degrees and it could be the best you ever had. By the way I do all my steaks frozen also so tender and juicie perfect medium rare every time.
customer_reviews.author: D. GOEDEL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an apartment
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this grill. Food doesn't fall through grates. You can control temp. No flare ups and you don't have to worry about burning your hand on the lid which is attached and slides up. Perfect for an apartment patio.
customer_reviews.author: Chill

customer_reviews.title: Cooks too hot
customer_reviews.text: The build quality of this grill is exceptional. The IR grate system works well to prevent flair ups but it just cooks too hot. It will burn you hot dogs on the outside before the inside it cooked even on the lowest setting. The same with burgers. You can't just put the burgers on low and do other things and come back and flip them. You have to be there the whole time or the outside of the burger will be scorched and the inside still medium rare. The regulator valve needs to allow for a lower heat level.
customer_reviews.author: Tom G.

customer_reviews.title: Best grill I’ve owned
customer_reviews.text: Took a steak or two to get used to but turn it on and once it’s hot 5 mins a side and done. Perfect grill without taking up the room. No signs of rust and the ashes clean up easy with the tool provided. Edit: 9 Months later still cooks like a champ! 5 min a side once per side medium and 5 min a side twice per side for well. Left closed outside when not in use and still no signs of rust. Perfect grill for my family.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Slonecker

customer_reviews.title: Cooks really fast
customer_reviews.text: A true, infrared portable grill. You must follow the instructions and preheat a minimum of 10 to 15 minutes, or it won’t produce a good sear on the meat It uses a lot of gas, about 1 pound per hour. It cooks incredibly fast, be prepared to flip your steaks over in about two minutes per side. Well made, and pretty robust. As others had mentioned, the heat control is basically just on or off. It is also imperative that the grill is seasoned with high temperature cooking oil just prior to cooking and after cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Evanchik

customer_reviews.title: Awesome small grill for searing and quick cooking.
customer_reviews.text: Great grill. Very portable, everything works. Igniter wiring looks a bit weak, may have to re-wire sooner rather than later. Be sure to burn off for 5-10 minutes every time after cooking, makes a big difference.
customer_reviews.author: James R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for burgers and steaks
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy design, simple to pack and store, also very easy to use. My complaint is the temperature control. It works fine for grilling steaks and burgers but it lacks the temperature control for things like chicken. Even at the lowest heat setting the temperature soars to 600F and will incinerate chicken in no time. I really want to like this thing and I am going to try adding the Bayou valve that others have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: D Dog

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: This things promises a lot and falls short on Ll accounts. It’s an awful barbecue. Heat is delivered unevenly. It’s a nightmare to clean. And yes, it has flare-ups. I’m not even sure about the infrared grilling. Try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: It cooks things...
customer_reviews.text: It's HOT, or not. Have to learn to use the fire on both sides of the meat, then turn it off for finishing with just the heat of the box. Really needs heat adjustment that works. Gets smokey and flares up quickly. I'd definitely trade the stainless grill for cast iron, as well. Meats stick even with the use of oil spray. It does work well enough when you alter your cooking methods to the quirks. So, points there. I should've read consumer reports before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Brezina

customer_reviews.title: just don’t
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely hate this thing. It doesn’t let the grease drain thru and it pools up and burns making for a funky smell during use. The flame control doesn’t work, even on the lowest setting it will nuke your food (exceeds 550 degrees). I gave it several chances and it just gets worse and now I’m outside the return window. So it’ll be going into the scrap pile for recycling.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Needs custom accessories to be a complete solution $$
customer_reviews.text: Overall seems well built however it buns too hot and haven’t fount the right regulator to control that issue. Also looking for a good cover to protect from the four season elements when on extended outdoor adventures. Sad to see the price drop so much since I purchased it but it would be fair if it included solutions to these two problems. Please reply with any suggestions to the above two issues. Thank you 🐾
customer_reviews.author: Seaside

customer_reviews.title: Great grill with no control whatsoever........
customer_reviews.text: Love the grill except for the total lack of a functioning thermostat control valve---------it's full on or off period! My brother in laws is the same so it's part of the package. Sad they cannot provide a working thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Lane

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small grill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our boat grill and I don’t have a bad thing to say about it! It’s the perfect size, we can grill for 6 people on it (I was impressed) and it cooks burgers and steaks to perfection. It doesn’t seem to get blown out in the wind like our old grill used to which is great. Super portable with the handles makes it easy to move around or travel with it. Hopefully it has a nice long life but can guarantee I’ll be buying another to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Good grill. Junk regulator.
customer_reviews.text: Likes: solid case and handles. Nice drip pan. Easy clean for a grill. Nice and portable. Dislike: gas regulator is junk and does not do anything. Plan to buy a replacement one on Amazon. With lid closed, temp will easily reach 650. Must prop open lid or just leave it totally open to get lower temps. Bought mine cheaper via Amazon Warehouse so cost of new regulator ($14) still made it a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Fixit

customer_reviews.title: Finally a grill that gets hot!
customer_reviews.text: Really love this grill. Gets hot easy to clean and the steaks are off the chart. I like my steaks a little charred and this does a great job. This started on my boat then went to my apt now I am buying one for the house and another for the boat so I will have three of them. Cheers.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Regulator
customer_reviews.text: Great Grill and it works very well. If you follow the directions and keep it clean its perfect. The only thing I dont understand why they would use a cheesy regulator that plugs up. When i first lit the grill I knew this would be a point of contention. It's really a shame that Charbroil put their faith in this Reg. I have ordered another regulator hoping that they have changed the design and if not I will blow this thing up on the review page.
customer_reviews.author: Unk

customer_reviews.title: Good grill. Not so good gas controller.
customer_reviews.text: I like the grill. Nicely portable. I keep it by the patio door and carry it outside to use it. It Cooks as well as the larger CharBroil Infrared grill that I used for about 5 years. I do not like the gas control/regulator. The instructions with the grill do not cover the regulator. I almost broke the regulator the first time that I used it. I have years of experience using large and small camp stoves that were powered with small propane bottles like this unit. None had such an unintuitive gas control. I really expect more from CharBroil.
customer_reviews.author: arcticgardener

customer_reviews.title: The grill was great for about a year and then it went "wacky"
customer_reviews.text: The grill was great for about a year and then it went "wacky". The heat was extremely uneven and the flame went out alot. Gas regulation was horrible.
customer_reviews.author: VagabondStu

customer_reviews.title: Great grill bag! Everything in one bag!
customer_reviews.text: Two propane bottles can fit underneath and other accessories. The grill fits perfect. Adjust the clips and snap the handles together. Material is thick, of quality. Everything in one... grab and go!!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Jones

customer_reviews.title: Worth While Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my father for Father's Day. He wanted to downsize from a traditional gas grill to something much smaller since he only grills for my mother and himself. He has used it multiple times and loves how quickly it is to setup, how quickly it is to temperature and how even it cooks their food. He said the he definitely recommends this grill and likes it more than his traditional big gas grill.
customer_reviews.author: Tice

customer_reviews.title: Cooks to perfection in minutes.
customer_reviews.text: We have used a full sized unit for several years and love it. We bought this one for our camper. It's fast, easy and the food comes out perfectly cooked and juicy. A medium done 12 oz. steak takes about 5 minutes to cook to perfection. A whole chicken is done in less than 20 minutes. Crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. There's a bit of a learning curve switching from charcoal or gas.
customer_reviews.author: Jlann

customer_reviews.title: Cannot regulate the heat - only by leaving the lid open
customer_reviews.text: I just talked to the Char-Broil help line and was told NO you cannot regulate the temperature. Leaving the lid open is the only way to lower any temperature in any fashion. She told me that "infrared cooking is designed to cook fast so you can get back to doing 'other things' " I do wish I had not put the box in recycle as I sure would return this thing!! BTW: I asked her if she was absolutely sure and she said yes, she answers this same question 'every single day'.
customer_reviews.author: gardener97

customer_reviews.title: This unit burns everything and clogs the openings and keeps burning awful
customer_reviews.text: I grill at home 3- 5 times a week, i have a Tragger smoker and know what I am doing, we bought this to use camping and it was awful, closes nicely, carries nicely but just don't use it, it burns everything, the grill is awful, can't clean it and the heat was not even from front to back, I think they forgot how to make things with this unit.....never again, sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: One Star for quality control. Fingers on heat shield bent, paint cracked off on one end, the other end repainted with brush and instruction manual crammed in plastic bag before being taped. On several reviews this was top rated, however I would not purchase it again or recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great grill!
customer_reviews.text: We've had one of these grills for several years, which we use every weekend. Our "big" grill at home needed to be replaced and we replaced it with another of these. It's a great grill! There are just two of us at home, and it has plenty of room. If we have family over (11 total), there's enough room to cook burgers and hot dogs on it.
customer_reviews.author: Hoosiermama

customer_reviews.title: Best Grill Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grill. Probably the best i've ever owned. It's lightweight and truly portable. It heats to 650 degrees F in just a few minutes. I've grilled ribeye steaks medium rare in just about two minutes per side. Obvious grill marks. I'd recommend this grill to anyone. For a quick, from start to steaks on the table about 15 mind, easy to use, very friendly grill you can't go wrong. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Grill
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent grill for its size and intended use. Great heat output and maybe too good. The only negative is a low heat setting on the regulator is difficult to achieve. Suggest you buy an accessory control valve to help maintain a lower flame. I bought the "Bayou Classic Brass Control Valve" suggested on the Amazon page.
customer_reviews.author: Jmctn

customer_reviews.title: This is a sturdy little grill
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy little grill. I use it with an LP tank and the 4 ft hose and adapter. All works very well. The only con is that it does get very hot, even on the lowest setting. To keep from over cooking I have to cook with the lid open most of the time. Loses some of the smoky flavor that way.
customer_reviews.author: sykes

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: It’s good product but very heavy to be portable. The temperature is not existing they only temperatures is super hot. I will have to modify the gas intake to be able to reduce. The regulator is a joke. But again the heat plate and the unit is sturdy and heavy I hope once I modify the intake I can control the temperature in order to be able to grill properly without burning the food
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Coronado

customer_reviews.title: Great Affordable Portable Grill!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a very good grill and matches most of the positive reviews posted. I would recommend this to other folks looking for a portable grill but not wanting to spend tons of money to have one (i.e. Weber). The only draw back is if you have food with lots of sauce/marinade, it will clog the holes on the grate causing the cooking temps to drop low.
customer_reviews.author: C. Neville

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice little rugged unit. Construction seems to be very well. Can't wait to use it! (original 5 star report, Feb 2015) Ok, after living with this grill for a little while now (Sept 2015), I have to say there is one MAJOR flaw in it. The flame constantly blows out in the slightest wind. I have to build "wind breaks" and continuously watch to see that it is still on. It's a real pain. The rest of the unit is holding up well. The folded 'grate' is a bugger to clean. Everything sticks to it and if it's not clean, the little holes get blocked and the oils can't drain off.
customer_reviews.author: Todd157k

customer_reviews.title: Cooked a steak perfectly for the first time
customer_reviews.text: This grill is just the right size and easy to use. With the temperature gauge on top, I was able to get the right temperature for my steak. I have been trying to grill a steak correctly for a couple of years. I finally got it right. It came out just the way I wanted. I really like this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Grandmom1+6

customer_reviews.title: Well made product but temperature is way too hot for most things
customer_reviews.text: The grill is high quality. The issue I have is it doesn't really have a low setting even when you turn it all the way down it is still too hot for a lot of things (and I don't see that the flame really adjusts). If you try to roast veggies they burn and you can't toast your buns on it. Am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MLW

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: I have a large 3 burner Char-Broil infrared grill that I was very pleased with, so I thought this little Grill2Go (model 12401734) would be great for my camper. WRONG: It is a piece of junk, the regulator will not lower the flame, the grate is cheap metal, which is also the only separation from the flame. The replacement for the regulator is out of stock. What a surprise. DO NOT BUY CHAR-BROIL. Go buy a Webber, you will be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Good and Bad
customer_reviews.text: Good - Easy to set up and use. Gets HOT quickly. Good grease and dripping tray that is easy to remove and clean up. BAD - regulator and temperature control is WORTHLESS. It has one temperaure - HOT-650. I did read other reviews and bought a needle valve and necessary brass fittings to make it work, This is necessary to make this grill usable. I think a good adjustable regulator would probably work better. I don't believe the grate is stainless steel. I have used it twice and it already has rust on it. If it lasts as long as the warranty then it is probably worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: david holland

customer_reviews.title: No flare ups in 2 years of use, great little gas grill
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd one. At this price I bought and extra as the parts that\t will need replacing over time would cost more than the $76 I paid for this one. It cooks fast, uses very little fuel and no flare ups. I don't mean less flare ups, absolutely none. After a couple of years you may want to replace the grate, it cost $17 when we replaced ours, one reason I bought this extra one. We RV 5 months each year and found this was our best option while on the road. The no flare ups was why we bought it, the fast cooking time was an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Sandman

customer_reviews.title: This little gem is the best. It will heat up to 700 degrees
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh! Where do I start? This little gem is the best. It will heat up to 700 degrees....no joke! We bought it to take on our boat to the beach in SW Florida, but we find ourselves using it a lot at home instead of our giant one. It is great!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: jlc-florida

customer_reviews.title: Great cooking results
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for up to 4 people for most things. Quick to heat up and I like the infrared cooking results. Replaced my well used round Char-Broil Infrared Patio Bistro. This one has a better grease collection trap, and the grill is easier to remove for a thorough cleaning. I would have given it 5 stars if there was better adjustment of the cooking temperature. On lowest setting, still pretty hot. But even so, results are always good. Don't overcook! 3/4" steak gets to medium rare in about 3 minutes per side. I suggest you set a timer. I do and never have to worry about monitoring or checking for doneness.
customer_reviews.author: Napa Vino

customer_reviews.title: Works great, well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy set up, be sure to heat it at least 15 minutes to burn off plastic smell. I cooked a 1 inch 14oz rib eye in 7 minutes. I also used apple pellets wrapped in foil to keep the ash at a minim. It works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: MisterEman

customer_reviews.title: Nice grill. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice size for one or two people, has a much more solid feel than most grills of this size, and it really does cook with fewer flareups and with lower temperatures. I "seasoned" the grill before using it for the first time, just as the instructions said to, and my ribeye didn't stick at all. I like that the lid clamps shut tightly, and I like the temperature gauge that is built into the lid. All-in-all, a good, thoughtful, well-executed design. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Scott K

customer_reviews.title: Added accessory a must.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this grill without buying the bayou classic needle valve unless you like eating briquettes. Waaaaay too hot! I wouldn't have attempted chicken without being able to slow down the gas flow. This grill sucks without it. You can't cook below 450° without the needle valve. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: B. Vodehnal

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill
customer_reviews.text: My husband said this is the best grill ever. Takes a little getting use to it....cooks really fast. We have used this grill more than any other grill, and it has cooked the steaks better than any other.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Martin

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME BBQ!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect! Took more propane to finish cooking my first time. I did preheat for about 15 minutes as suggested and oiled my grill. 1 can will last about 25-30 minutes. I dont like that after one use the top see through temp reader gets burnt with smoke color but other than that this BBQ is heavy duty, sturdy and cooks evenly! I had great flames when I needed and all in all this is a perfect condo patio BBQ plus it can go anywhere its so durable. It didnt leak juice and has a drip pan. Wish it had a cover!
customer_reviews.author: Marla

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying
customer_reviews.text: I gave this grill 4 stars but it should really be a 3 because the grate is a pain in the ass to clean. The cleaning tool seems too short to really get in between the spaces and reach the little vents. You have to turn the too sideways. I would recommend soaking the grate before u clean it otherwise you’ll be scrubbing like a mad man. Overall it’s a pretty good grill. It’s worth the money for a quick grilled dinner.
customer_reviews.author: GTG

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy this grill once I learned what it does and ...
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this grill once I learned what it does and how to use it. It cooks at very high heat unlike all other grilling I've done in the past. It is easy to think you have a bad grill but give it time, watch a video snd learn to enjoy it as I did. Go on and buy the adaptor hose to use a 20 pound bottle instead of buying the 1 pound bottle
customer_reviews.author: DaGama

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill
customer_reviews.text: Great little grill, bought for our rv however it came with the regulator reversed. Instead of contacting Amazon I contacted char broil, and although promised a replacement regulator received a run around for 2 weeks... now corrected however, I will deal directly with amazon customer service in the future. Mch better service
customer_reviews.author: Nick D.

customer_reviews.title: OMG
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I have had $1200.00 BBQs! Extra heating units on the side. Tons of drawers and tools! Finally I purchased the Char-Broil BBQ. Wished I know about true infrared cooking. OMG a small BBQ that has the heat, no flare ups, gives the nice BBQ lines, and only cost about$150! It does smoke a lot because the grease burns off making less clean up.
customer_reviews.author: bill n sue

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill - best of the 9 portable grills I have had over the years.
customer_reviews.text: Grill works great! Over the years I have tried many portable grills in my campers and this one is the very best. It cooks evenly and is so easy to handle and clean up. It is small and easy to store, not too heavy. You can fit a lot of food on the cooking surface too. One word of wisdom - don't waste your money on the cover for this grill. Expensive and almost useless. Make your own carrier to store it in your camper and you will be a lot better off.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie P. Moses

customer_reviews.title: Nice Grill - Burns hot
customer_reviews.text: Can't control the temp very well. Cooks very hot, even on low. Still a good product though!
customer_reviews.author: Don Keller

customer_reviews.title: Best portable grill we've tried
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to some of the reviews, I have found this grill to be extremely easy to clean with the included scraper and the very convenient grease tray. We bought the grill to use with our travel trailer on RV trips and have found it to be absolutely the best all-around portable grill that we've ever used. It is solidly built, provides even heat and really does a nice job. There was a bit of a learning curve, and I made the mistake of having the grill too hot at first. After a couple uses, however, I was pleased with the cooking results. We are most definitely very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BobV

customer_reviews.title: Great portable grill!
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill! I have an infrared grill for home and I was thrilled to find this one to use for trips in our RV. It cooks very evenly. Heats up quickly. We went on a 10 day camping trip and only used 1 full tank of propane and had just started the 2nd tank. The drip tray is large and easy to remove from the front and empty and wipes out in a flash. Shipping was fast, it even came a day early.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Strutz

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it will last years if taken care of
customer_reviews.text: Very solid portable grill! It gets smoking hot, no problem grilling a steak on the trail! You have to turn this grill down some or you will burn what you are cooking. Looks like it will last years if taken care of. Good sized grilling area. It also cleans well because you can turn it up and burn off the residue after each use.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Lapelle Hash

customer_reviews.title: Easy no tool assembly in less than 5 minutes!
customer_reviews.text: So nice, and very sturdy! I got it so quick. It arrived in perfect condition, and best of all.....NO ASSEMBLY REQUIRED! You just unwrap each piece and set it back in the grill. Twist on the regulator and ready to go. Less than 5 minutes. For the money it has to be the best deal on a camping grill! But very nice as well. Nothing like other grills at this price! Would definitely buy it again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P.

customer_reviews.title: Cooks great. Does run a little hot(better than not getting ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been cooking on this for 2 years now every time we go out in the motorhome. Cooks great. Does run a little hot(better than not getting hot enough). I just open the top if it is cooking something too fast like chicken. Cooks steaks the best. Puts a good sear on them.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've had this grill for about a year now and I use it a lot. There's small openings in the metal plate surface that you cook your food on. It clogs up so fast with meat drippings or sauces that it makes the cooking surface unusable. I will never purchase another grill with this type of heating surface. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Huttner

customer_reviews.title: Struggle with Temp Control
customer_reviews.text: Can't get the temperature to regulate. Even with the dial it's got one temperature, super hot. I've resorted to cooking with the top held open about an inch to keep the temp down.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey h.

customer_reviews.title: Nice grill
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my husband for Christmas a year or two ago. It was what he asked for, and he has been very happy with it. Very compact for taking on our camping trips, and grills steaks just as well as our fancy grill at home! The carry case is great too.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Grill, Fits Nice In Tote
customer_reviews.text: I do love this grill. Heats up as advertised. The regulator is complete garbage. I purchased a better regulator to use with a 20lb tank. I bought a Husky 25 gal Latch and Stack tote. Grill fits nicely, a little too tall but the lid latches.
customer_reviews.author: igotthelife!!!

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: It was either too hot or not hot enough. The grill holes clogged constantly and caused a lot of smoking.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Very good item
customer_reviews.text: Great grill. I use it in place of a big grill. It is portable and easy to use with either a small bottle or a large tank of gas when purchased with a Char-Broil hose. It is not purely infrared but cost a third of the pure infrared grills. it does not flare-up which is a plus when cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: This grill is terrible !
customer_reviews.text: First it came with a damaged pressure regulator. I replaced it. Then the spark generator will shock you when you try to lite the burner. The insulated wire to the burner broke. Now the thing shuts off in the middle of cooking. When it does stay lit---it cooks extremely hot--not much temperature regulation, between Hi ,med ,and low. Read other reviews. Buy it if you want to waste your money--but-be warned. This thing is going in the trash tomorrow. Wasted my money and my time.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Love this grill.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant because of the reviews about this grill being too hot. I am not sure if they fixed the issue or what. But mine works great. I did heat it to burn off any smell. I also oiled the grill surface and heated it several times to season it. I then placed a packet of wood chips inside and heated it again. The grill does smoke a lot. So I would not recommend it for small areas or places where the smoke will be a problem. The grill makes very nice marks. Heats fast and stays cool on the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Best grill
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use at my old apartment and for tailgating at events. This is honestly the best grill I’ve owned. Cooks even, heats up nicely, and leaves the meat nice and juicy. Only bad thing I can say is cleaning after using it can be a pain but I used it 3 times a week in the summer months. I would recommend this this to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Tyler S.

customer_reviews.title: It heats up very fast and follow cooking manual.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good little infrared grill. Heats up quickly and cooks food very evenly. The regulator connector could be a little more secure, but doesn't leak. uses a lot less propane fuel than my char-broil portable gas grill. I bought the universal 4' hose and adapter for conversion to a 20lb tank. Be sure to follow the cooking manual /recipe booklet, food cooks up a lot quicker. I love it, it cooks meat evenly and retains the natural juice in the meat!!
customer_reviews.author: William Brown

customer_reviews.title: Pre season grill before use
customer_reviews.text: We use this camping. Pre seasoned the grill and it works great. Grilling is fast, clean up easy, nephew’s also loved this grills ability to cook 12 burgers, 10 hotdogs and 5 chicken breast’s. We did cook all this in shifts but the results were great.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: amazon wont refund the difference in price
customer_reviews.text: grill is great but i have never shop someplace that lowers there price and will not adjust within 10 days ridiculous they want you to return it then buy again makes no sense at all buyer beware nothing worse than buying something and see it for less on same site. i expect more than this from amazon very disappointing to say the least
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: RUNS HOT
customer_reviews.text: Only reason this is a 4 star grill is because the ability to regulate the tempature is missing. There is hot and then magma. 650 plus degree the entire time. Lowest setting is 650 plus. As lojg as u r watching ur food this is the grill for you. Hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: TNAUTH

customer_reviews.title: Cooks Hot - Fix
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, it cooks very hot. I ordered the Bayou valve to add inline, but was not able to use it because I was unable to unscrew the 1/8 inch short pipe from the valve. For the same reason I would not have been able to put a needle valve inline. So I did as others have suggested, and simply propped the cover open a bit and it cooked fine on low. I found by drilling a hole in the side of the plastic handle, I could insert a screwdriver to keep the lid propped open for cooking. Photo attached.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: Best little grill for every day use, great for apartments too!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny, I purchased the adapter that lets me hook it up to my big tank and I have it setup at the garage door on a plastic 4 foot table, yes plastic. The bottom does not get hot at all so you can be confident if you take it somewhere you wont have any issues no matter where you put it. This grill heats evenly, it really does! I was skeptical with the no hot spots claim but it really is true, the whole surface is evenly heated making it much easier to cook multiple items. I have purchased many things on Amazon and I can say this grill is in the top 10!
customer_reviews.author: merlin696

customer_reviews.title: Filthy and had been used.
customer_reviews.text: We just opened the box to find it had been used and is filthy. It had a note in it to whoever had it prior to us. We paid full new price. Obviously not new.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Cecilia G. Kidder

customer_reviews.title: Best grill
customer_reviews.text: This grill gets so hot and cooks more evenly than any other grill I have used. I leave it out all year and have gone throuh 2 of them and a few regulators but for the money when this one goes I'm getting another one. Nothing lasts forever, especially grills.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Campanella

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed Portable That Cooks Fast (maybe too fast)
customer_reviews.text: Well designed for transporting. Super sturdy. Heats up fast. But, not much control over the heat - so watch you don't burn your steaks! Not good for slow cooking. Like most gas grills, it doesn't impart any smokey flavor. I prefer charcoal grills, but those are not allowed in my apartment complex. I may try wood chips next time I grill.
customer_reviews.author: Alan from Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Burns everything I try to cook
customer_reviews.text: Burns everything I try to cook I purchased this item because I have a full-size infrared cooking unit and love it because it doesn't burn things this one has no adjustment on the flame regulator or anything
customer_reviews.author: Dpraces

product_meta.title: Char-Broil Grill2Go X200 Portable TRU-Infrared Liquid Propane Gas Grill
product_meta.description:
Style:Portable Grill2GoThis traveling grill will cook your food to perfection using Char-broil's TRU Infrared technology. Its high-impact frame with legs and carry handles makes it easy to take with you. Perfect for tailgating, camping or road trips!

AMAZON.COM


You can grill on the go, and ignite your taste buds anywhere you are hungry, with the Char-Broil Grill2Go X200! This roadworthy powerhouse doesn't mind getting tossed around; its rugged construction and latching lid are built to survive the adventure; whether that means canyon camping or competitive tailgating. Built-in, push-button ignition requires no batteries to ignite a 9,500 BTU burner powered by a small and easily portable 16.4 oz. disposable LP cylinder, while the no flare-up TRU-Infrared cooking system cooks even in the coldest climates 

The Char-Broil Grill2Go x200 is a simple and lightweight tabletop grill that enables you to cook your favorite foods while fishing, tailgating, camping, or relaxing at the beach - with the high quality that only Char-Broil TRU Infrared can deliver in a portable grill. The perfectly portable grill weighs less than 20 pounds, but don’t let the size fool you: with 200 square inches of cooking surface, you can grill burgers or hotdogs for more than a carload full of friends! With convenient push-button ignition, this travel grill quickly heats up to grill burgers, chicken, vegetables, and more! 

The Grill2Go x200 even features a die-cast firebox and aluminum lid built to survive the adventure away from home. The lid is hinged to the rest of the grill to keep things simple when you have limited space but want to cook, the large handle allows you to open and close the lid safely and easily. When it's time to go, packing up is hassle-free with the securely latching top and dual Cool-Touch heat-resistant handles. Quality rust-resistant and durable steel construction with a black porcelain finish helps to extend the life of your grill – plus, the stainless steel cooking grate is a snap to clean. 

HOW TRU-INFRARED WORKS
All Char-Broil TRU-Infrared grills generate a minimum of 65 percent infrared heat, which is evenly spread across the entire cooking surface to cook food -- without drying -- at temperatures that range from simmer to sear.

 

Unlike traditional gas grills that use convective heat (hot air) to cook food, Char-Broil's TRU-Infrared grills limit the hot air flow and use natural, radiant heat to cook food directly without drying. While convective heat destroys food's moisture barrier, infrared heat penetrates it without drying and locks in natural juices and flavors. Char-Broil's TRU-Infrared cooking system virtually eliminates flare-ups while producing very even heat (no hot or cold spots). 

ADDITIONAL FEATURES 
 * Ignition tucked inside right front leg to protect from damage 
 * Hood-mounted temperature gauge 
 * 200 sq. in. total cooking surface
 * Stainless steel grilling grate/li> 
 * 9,500 BTU main burner 
 * Easily converted for use with a 20 lb. tank (sold separately - Char-Broil model 5584623) 
 * Grill size: 23.7"W x 15.7"D x 13.6"H 
 * Weighs 20 lbs.

Cast aluminum firebox and lid with dual stainless steel latches and temp gauge
High-impact frame with legs and carry handles
200 square inch stainless steel grilling grate
